example[0]: I have absolute confidence in her.
example[1]: We don’t know with absolute certainty that the project will succeed.
definition[1]: used to emphasize your opinion about something or someone
example[2]: Some of the stuff on TV is absolute rubbish.
example[3]: How did you do that? You’re an absolute genius.
example[4]: That meal last night cost an absolute fortune.
definition[2]: definite and not likely to change
example[5]: We need absolute proof that he took the money.
example[7]: Parents used to have absolute power over their children.
definition[4]: true, correct, and not changing in any situation
example[8]: You have an absolute right to refuse medical treatment.
definition[5]: something that is considered to be true or right in all situations
example[9]: She believed in the importance of moral absolutes.
